alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Coastal Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued September 22 at 12:14AM EDT until September 23 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of up to 5 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...South Carolina Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 11 AM Thursday to 11 PM EDT Friday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from Thursday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Coastal Jasper
